author: @WTVYNews4
title: Alabama is a winter wonderland
text: Alabama is a winter wonderland DOTHAN, Ala. (WTVY) - Snow covers north Alabama, with seven inches falling in isolated areas, as the entire state braced for dangerously low temperatures. Some of the higher snow reports so far are from Lauderdale County: 7.5 inches in Lexington, 4 inches in Waterloo, 6 inches near Underwood, 3.75 in Cloverdale in and 2 inches in Florence, [AL.com reported Tuesday evening](https://www.al.com/news/2024/01/alabama-sees-4-inches-of-snow-in-areas-with-more-winter-weather-on-the-way-what-to-expect.html). In central and south Alabama, ice is possible along roadways, with precipitation forecasted to be out of the state before noon on Tuesday. [READ MORE: Governor declares state of emergency as snow and ice head toward Alabama](https://www.wtvy.com/2024/01/14/governor-declares-state-emergency-snow-ice-head-toward-alabama/) Temperatures will remain below freezing in most of the state during the day on Tuesday then tumble on that night. By Wednesday morning, they are forecast to range from near zero in the Tennessee Valley to about 20 in the Dothan area.
